summary: Eric Starvo Galt is an alias used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King, Jr. CIA cables disseminated information about Galt, along with his other aliases Harvey Lowmyer and John Willard, to multiple locations worldwide in an effort to locate him following the assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr. The CIA's actions were undertaken at the FBI's request, and involved gathering information on Ray's aliases and whereabouts through overseas liaison services.
significance: Eric Starvo Galt is significant as one of the aliases used by James Earl Ray, the suspected assassin of Martin Luther King, Jr. The use of this alias was part of Ray's attempt to evade capture after the assassination.
